title: VFMSUBADD132PD/VFMSUBADD213PD/VFMSUBADD231PD â€” Fused Multiply-Alternating Subtract/Add of Packed Double-Precision Floating-Point Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VFMSUBADD132PD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VFMSUBADD213PD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VFMSUBADD231PD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VFMSUBADD132PD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VFMSUBADD213PD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VFMSUBADD231PD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VFMSUBADD132PD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VFMSUBADD213PD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VFMSUBADD231PD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VFMSUBADD132PD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VFMSUBADD213PD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VFMSUBADD231PD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VFMSUBADD132PD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst{er}`
`VFMSUBADD213PD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst{er}`
`VFMSUBADD231PD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst{er}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: VFMSUBADD132PD: Multiplies the two, four, or eight packed double-precision floating-point values from the first source operand to the two or four packed double-precision floating-point values in the third source operand. From the infinite precision intermediate result, subtracts the odd double-precision floating-point elements and adds the even double-precision floating-point values in the second source operand, performs rounding and stores the resulting two or four packed double-precision floating-point values to the destination operand (first source operand).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VFMSUBADD213PD: Multiplies the two, four, or eight packed double-precision floating-point values from the second source operand to the two or four packed double-precision floating-point values in the first source operand. From the infinite precision intermediate result, subtracts the odd double-precision floating-point elements and adds the even double-precision floating-point values in the third source operand, performs rounding and stores the resulting two or four packed double-precision floating-point values to the destination operand (first source operand).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VFMSUBADD231PD: Multiplies the two, four, or eight packed double-precision floating-point values from the second source operand to the two or four packed double-precision floating-point values in the third source operand. From the infinite precision intermediate result, subtracts the odd double-precision floating-point elements and adds the even double-precision floating-point values in the first source operand, performs rounding and stores the resulting two or four packed double-precision floating-point values to the destination operand (first source operand).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded versions: The destination operand (also first source operand) and the second source operand are ZMM/YMM/XMM register. The third source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 64-bit memory location. The destination operand is conditionally updated with write mask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The destination operand (also first source operand) is a YMM register and encoded in reg_field. The second source operand is a YMM register and encoded in VEX.vvvv. The third source operand is a YMM register or a 256-bit memory location and encoded in rm_field.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The destination operand (also first source operand) is a XMM register and encoded in reg_field. The second source operand is a XMM register and encoded in VEX.vvvv. The third source operand is a XMM register or a 128-bit memory location and encoded in rm_field. The upper 128 bits of the YMM destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Compiler tools may optionally support a complementary mnemonic for each instruction mnemonic listed in the opcode/instruction column of the summary table. The behavior of the complementary mnemonic in situations involving NANs are governed by the definition of the instruction mnemonic defined in the opcode/instruction column.

fields.value:
`VFMSUBADDxxxPD __m512d _mm512_mask_fmsubadd_round_pd(__m512d a, __mmask8 k, __m512d b, __m512d c, int r);
`

`

`
